properties.title: finally decide to pack up wet tent after procrastinating for an hour
properties.description: The water was still dripping from the tree leaves as I woke up this morning. I wallowed in my dry tent for a while before admitting to myself that it would just be easier to pack up camp instead of waiting for perfectly dry skies.

properties.title: liquids and toothpaste restock at rite-aid
too many trucks on this road
blow thru road closed sign because i dont wanna find detour, construction workers don't care anyways
no shoulder and only big trucks wow great welcome indiana
have i mentioned this road sucks
have i mentioned this road sucks
circle k food sucks i couldn't even finish that sando
properties.description: I stopped at a Circle K and purchased a truly unpalatable sandwich, which I could only get through half of, a banana, a cookie, and a Gatorade refill.

properties.title: ok those pancakes were fire though wow good stuff
properties.description: The short jaunt to Garrett was mostly calm, and I dined at a pancake house that did indeed make truly great flapjacks. I had a kind waitress on her first day of work.

properties.title: its broiling theres no shade and this road is in dire condition
warm welcome at pretty state park
properties.description: I arrived at Chain O Lakes where a cheery park attendant greeted me, gave me directions, and told me to be safe. The campground is the nicest I’ve been at so far - bathrooms, showers (which I unfortunately can’t use), and a general store.

properties.title: pitch tent, nice chat with woman at general store, retiree invites me for dinner in his rv
properties.description: The older man in the camper across the way invited me over for burgers. I didn’t realize he meant literally inside his small RV trailer - but I obliged nonetheless. We talked over grapes while the burgers were grilling. He is a recently retired widower of ten years who loves fishing and boating of all kinds. He was eager to show me his catches for the day - lots of fish indeed. He was very kind to me and offered lots of food, most of which I declined as I was quite full from the pancake house meal. He eventually asked to see my bike, which I decided was the opportunity for me to head back to my tent. He said grace before we ate and had conservative talk radio as a perennial background - not my cup of tea.
